Implemented by FXB Rwanda, a local CSO, Turengere Abana provides community based care and support to improve health, social and economic wellbeing of OVC and their families. Turengere Abana identifies and reaches vulnerable populations, strengthens referral systems, and responds to community needs. By the end of FY15, FXB will improve social and economic wellbeing of 85,000 vulnerable adults and children in 14 sectors in 7 districts in Rwanda. A mapping exercise was performed to confirm that there was no duplication of services. Activities include: livelihood grants and training, health behavior change training; access to health insurance, education and vocational training support, child protection, psychosocial counseling, safe water/hygiene, case management and mentoring for OVC, their families and other vulnerable households. Turengere Abana strengthens household resilience through health and nutrition, economic and social service provision, child protection, and GBV prevention and works to promote gender equality and combat human trafficking. The project strengthens referral systems and linkages between community and clinical services. In COP14 using only pipeline funds, Turengere Abana will continue these interventions towards sustainable health and social economic development, targeting 7,000 OVC to be reached with need-based age-appropriate services, and train 1,120 caregivers in caring for OVC. The expected result is strengthened capacity of CSOs, and community groups to support the most vulnerable children and families in a sustainable manner. FXB Rwanda has developed indicators and tools to monitor regularly progress and results at field level, measuring achievements on a regular basis. FXB Rwanda will report on MER indicators and custom indicators.
